Articles.Content:
http://www.twitch.tv/thereadpanda/v/34870170

TheReadPanda used to be OakTree42. The change was part of a rebranding. Now it’s more awesome, please follow this new channel! #KSP

First.  (Constructive, I know)

Really though, that explains why TheReadPanda popped up into the featured streams list.

Second! Hi guys! It is me, the Read Panda! That's read as in the past tense of the word pronounced as 'red'! Aren't homophones fun! It is a play on words! All part of a rebranding to add a youtube channel, webpage and twitter all under the same brand name! So come visit them all!

Heelloo. 

I really don't know epwhat squad did to the KSP forums on the 1/14/16? Can somebody plz tell me?

16 hours ago, TheReadPanda said:

Second! Hi guys! It is me, the Read Panda! That's read as in the past tense of the word pronounced as 'red'! Aren't homophones fun! It is a play on words! All part of a rebranding to add a youtube channel, webpage and twitter all under the same brand name! So come visit them all!  

But now how will I blame you for stuff? 

#blameoak is still more catchy

Hello OakTree42 !

I thought I saw you on stream a couple days ago ... I been busy lately so I will be on the lookout for the new name !

I too have had a change in my stream name - someone asked if I just jibbered my new name !

I hated when people kept asking what cdr meant ! Maybe Cmdr works now for me who knows! Too bad I cant change it here; oh well.

Cmdr Zeta = Commander Zeta = cdr_zeta < the little ole guy in the basement who now resides upstairs for awhile ...

You can still #blameoak  I do respond to the name Oak still, just wanted a unified way to link youtube, the web, and other things all under one name, and a name without a number in it at that, and a name that felt like it had some meaning. The name is pronounced 'the red panda' by the way, read as in past tense. Red/Read in that sense become homophones, two words that sound alike but are spelled differently and have different meanings. I thought it was a cute play on words and the 'read' linked into the educational slant I like to take with things! But as I said, #blameoak is still fine.
